revised_title: Assessing and Improving Rural Water Supply Technologies for Public Health
tldr: This article discusses the importance of improving rural water supply technologies for public health in developing countries. It highlights the diverse health hazards associated with poor water supplies, such as waterborne diseases, water-washed diseases, and diseases transmitted by invertebrate aquatic hosts or insect vectors. The author emphasizes the need for low-cost reticulation systems and various technological improvements to address these health issues effectively.
